headline: Trump Told to 'Face Reality' on GOP Radio Show as Georgia Candidate Slips
author: Alexandra Hutzler
sentences: Several audits and recounts of the race conducted by state officials reaffirmed Biden's victory in 2020, the first time a Democratic presidential candidate won the state in 28 years.
John Fredericks, host of The John Fredericks Show, told Trump on Tuesday to "face reality" as polls show Perdue behind incumbent Governor Brian Kemp in the Republican primary.
Trump again teased a 2024 White House run during the rally in Georgia, telling the crowd: "The truth is I ran twice, I won twice and I did much better the second time.
Trump's influence in the Peach Statewhich he lost to Joe Biden during the 2020 electionwill be tested this year as he has endorsed several candidates.
